overview_of_class: Chemistry 210-B is the second course in a three-term sequence in organic chemistry. It covers the chemistry of the major oxygen- and nitrogen-containing functional groups, as well as the chemistry of aromatic compounds. Mechanism is emphasized in the study of these materials. The course includes a laboratory component which includes an introduction to basic organic laboratory techniques, as well as the preparation, purification and characterization of organic substances. Includes a Saturday laboratory (CHEM 230-B) from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m.
name: Organic Chemistry
subject: CHEM
